intro: Chaerophyllum bobrovii, commonly known as Bobrov's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
